name: JOEL PATTON WORKSHOP
description:
Help us welcome Joel Patton as he introduces you to the scuptural forms of Tradition South Eastern Face Jugs. 
He will demonstrate and work with you to discover the hidden imagery with in your pottery with additive, 
subtractive and and assemblage techniques.  He will also discuss the history of face jugs, his inspiration and 
glazing techniques. 

Joel Patton grew up in James Island, SC and Travelers Rest, SC .  Joel has  shown work at  Hiawassee Mountain 
Arts Festival, North Georgia Folk Potters Festival, Potters on Gaffney's Old Field, Spring ArtFest 2013,
Looking Back, Walking Forward, The Upstairs Artspace, Tryon, NC, “Raw Reviews: Exhibitions,” Raw Vision, 
“A Different Face,” The Greenville News [Greenville, SC].  Joel takes inspiration from the Edgefield, SC pottery 
tradition. He focuses mainly on face jugs, and enjoys experimenting with traditional alakaline glaze recipes

Saturday 9am to 4pm & Sunday 11:30am to 5:30pm

Ask about our STRATOSPHERE RESORT packages

name: T-Shirt Clay Arts Vegas
description:
Have you got your CAV swag? 
Rock out with your very own Clay Arts Vegas t-shirt! 


They come in large or extra large!

name: 8 Week Class Non-Member*
description:
$125 for single 8 week class non-CAV Card Holders*

Non-CAV Card Holder class enrollment includes is a single class and one open studio per week.

Class Enrollment includes storage for your work, a locker for personal possessions during class, and of course assistance with choosing the best tools and Laguna clay to best suit your needs. We here at CAV are committed to ensuring that your experience is not only enjoyable, but one that keeps you coming back for more!

Also included is the use of the common facilities of The CAV Studios - a fully outfitted ceramics studio with a large range of equipment, including 10 wheels, hand-building tables, slab rollers, wedging tables, glazing area, extruders, and clay-friendly sinks.

name: Annual Membership
description:
Membership Benefits
CAV Club Card Membership
$50 per year with a purchase of a class

Benefits:

Use of the common facilities of Clay Arts Vegas during regular business hours - a fully outfitted ceramics studio with a large range of equipment, including 10 wheels, 2 hand-building tables, slab roller, wedging tables, glazing area, extruders, and clay-friendly sinks.

Access to Clay Arts Vegas during open studio hours and all adult regularly scheduled classes except Raku. (See Schedule) Studio members do not receive keys or security codes. To have access at other times of the day, please consider leasing one of our semi-private workspaces.

10% off workshop fees

10% off t-shirt price

A single use coupon for 20% discount off your total purchase at The Clay Store

Invitations to Gallery openings

Invitations to special firings

Opportunity to participate in the Members exhibition

name: 8 Week Class CAV Member
description:
Annual CAV Club Card Membership fee of $50 is not included in class membership price. Benefits include unlimited classes and open studio time (please see calendar for times).

Class Enrollment includes storage for your work, a locker for personal possessions during class, and of course assistance with choosing the best tools and Laguna clay to best suit your needs. We here at CAV are committed to ensuring that your experience is not only enjoyable, but one that keeps you coming back for more!

Also included is the use of the common facilities of The CAV Studios - a fully outfitted ceramics studio with a large range of equipment, including 10 wheels, hand-building tables, slab rollers, wedging tables, glazing area, extruders, and clay-friendly sinks.
